definition: (of a tide) to ebb or go out
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: TIDE】They liked to walk along the beach at low tide.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢在落潮时沿着海滨散步。

sentences.english: We may consider that the ebb delta of Shuidong tidal inlet is in a balance condition.
sentences.chinese: 水东潮汐通道的落潮三角洲处于均衡状态。

sentences.english: Color Mitsuzuka collapse a few years, the daily tide marks.
sentences.chinese: 几年崩冢色，每日落潮痕。

sentences.english: In the ebb, the part of the formation of coral atolls surface.
sentences.chinese: 在落潮时，部分的珊瑚礁露出水面形成珊瑚岛。

sentences.english: In Luo Chao, a portion of the formation of coral reefs are above the surface Island.
sentences.chinese: 在落潮时，部分的珊瑚礁露出水面形成珊瑚岛。

sentences.english: Does it not also sing with the waves that fall?
sentences.chinese: 难道它没有伴着落潮高歌？

sentences.english: The flood and ebb tides alternates with each other.
The ship was weighting anchor to get away before the falling tide left her stranded.
sentences.chinese: 船正在起锚开动，以免落潮使它搁浅。

sentences.english: They gathered shellfish at low tide.
sentences.chinese: 他们在落潮时采集贝壳类动物。

definition: (of a tide) to ebb or go out
(of water, prices etc) to rise and fall
